subject: Dear Fund Beneficiary,
body:
Dear Fund Beneficiary,
We have noticed with deep concern the fraudulent and corrupt practices
by some officials of the Nigerian and United Kingdom financial
institutions and government agencies formerly designated with the duty
to process and perform the remittances of various foreign
contract/compensation payments. These nefarious activities have put
Nigeria, United Kingdom in bad light among the committee of nations,
which have been very inimical to her economic growth and development.
It is a fact that some beneficiaries while trying to realize their
legitimate contract compensation payment have unsuspectingly fallen
prey to schemes and grand designs of these bad elements in Nigeria,
United Kingdom who create artificial impediments in the processing of
foreign contract compensation payment as devices to perpetrate fraud.
In need to restore and re-position the ailing Nigerian, United Kingdom
economy and status for improved direct foreign investments and
economic growth, the United Nations Office for the Coordination of
Humanitarian Affairs in collaboration with United Nations Economic
Commission for Africa (UN/ECA) was prevailed upon to wade into the matter
in partnershipwith the Nigerian, United Kingdom government to grapple with the
arduous task of restructuring for advancement the Nigerian, United
Kingdom economic and financial status, and to further effectiveness in
foreign payment resolution.
In the course of verification of your payment file, it was discovered
that you have satisfactorily completed all required legal and
financial obligations in respect of your payment. In this vein, it is my
pleasure to let you know that your blocked compensation payment funds
valued $5, 5 Million which was approved by the United Nations Office
for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs has been unblocked and
tagged for immediate payment to you in our Quarterly Payment Gazette
via our affiliated correspondence paying bank in Turkey as approved by
the United Nations.
The United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs
is a United Nations body established in December 1991 by the General
Assembly to strengthen the international response to complex
emergencies and natural disasters.
Kindly note your contract compensation Payment Reference No.22477781,
Allocation No: 69887664 Password No: 87658332, Pin Code No: 897673 and
your Certificate of Merit Payment No: 103, Released Code No: 0746;
unblocked Secret Code No: XZTW04473, haven received these vital
payment information numbers therefore you are now qualified to receive
your unblocked compensation payment funds valued $5, 5 million.
In view of this, henceforth you MUST stop any form of communication
with any person/persons in London UK or any African country regarding
any bogus payment because they were instrumental to your predicament.
Furthermore, it will interest you to know that we have been trying to
contact you but your email ID seems not to be active so should you
receive this message kindly forward to this office the following
accordingly.
1) Full Name
2) Current Contact Address
3) Your ID
4) Contact Telephone number.
Thanks and God bless.
Yours faithfully,
James D. Aramanda
Chief Executive Officer and President, the Clearing House LLC
450 West 33rd Street
New York, NY 10001

subject: Re: Dear Fund Beneficiary,
body:
Dear James D. Aramanda,

Thank you for your email and the information provided. I am glad to hear that my blocked payment funds have been unblocked and are ready for immediate payment.

Here are the details you requested:

Full Name: John Doe
Current Contact Address: 123 Main Street, Anytown, USA
ID: JD123456
Contact Telephone number: +1-555-555-5555

I look forward to hearing from you soon regarding the next steps in this process.

Best wishes,
Tommy
